result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Luis Ruiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Jail term is with HUBER privileges and is to commence immediately

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant is to Submit to any and all counseling recommendations per probation

Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): M.M.
**No Contact includes: Going to or remaining in any place the individual resides, is employed at, attends school at, or any public location the individual is temporarily located. Contact through means of telephone. Electronic devices, Social media, email, regular mail, or a 3rd party individual is prohibited. The only exception to this order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate circumstances.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Luis Ruiz

defendant.name: Ruiz, Daniel Luis
defendant.address: N8874 3rd Street, P.O. Box 1, Westboro, WI 54490

records.addlTxt: Letters from DCC Records staff to Court regarding sentence structure

9:47 AM DA Kelz calls case and states appearances. Defendant Daniel Luis Ruiz in court.  Attorney Shawn M Paul not in court.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Da Kelz states this was sent for a Plea and Sentencing however the defendant had sent a letter and is requesting to be revoked from probation for a straight sentence. Court makes comments in regards to the request. Court questions defendant as counsel has made a motion to withdraw being this case was "closed". Defendant states he would like to proceed with sentencing without an attorney. Defendant waives the right to an attorney. Court states the previous order for a withheld sentence is hereby vacated. Da Kelz makes recommendations and comments before sentencing. Defendant makes comments to the court. Court finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC. 
Ct. 1- Dismissed previously
Ct. 2- 
$243 Court Costs 
$200 DNA + Sample 
60 Days in the Price County Jail w/Huber 
Jail term is to commence Immediately 07/19/2022 
Defendant is given 3 days sentence credit 

Appeal Rights Given
Motion to Withdraw as Attorney
Order to Withdraw as Attorney
Request for probation revocation
Sentencing hearing on July 19, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Defendant's current info
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

3:24 PM Defendant Daniel Luis Ruiz in court.  Attorney Shawn M Paul in court for Daniel Luis Ruiz.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. DA Kelz states an agreement has been reached and recites the agreement on record. Contingent upon with the defendant's plea to Ct. 2 the State will move to Dismiss and read in Ct. 1. Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to Ct. 2 therefore Ct.  1 is DISMISSED and READ IN. DA Kelz states Victim's Rights Legislations have been complied with. Court questions DE regarding the plea. DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC. 
Court Imposes:
Ct. 1- DRI
Ct. 2- Withheld Sentence, 1 year probation 
Conditions of Probation: 
$300 Fine 
$200 DNA + Sample 
Counseling as recommended per probation 

Defendant is given 3 days sentence credit in the event probation is revoked

Appeal Rights Given
Written consent to contact

Preliminary hearing on June 27, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

11:00 AM DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Daniel Luis Ruiz appeared in court. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant in regards to counsel. Defendant gives responses stating he has obtained counsel however counsel was not available to be present today. Court will adjourn this matter for a later date to allow defendant's counsel to appear. Defendant will withdraw his prior request to NOT waive the Time limits for the Preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived. This matter will be rescheduled.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:17 AM Defendant Daniel Luis Ruiz appeared in court. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he has not recieved a copy of the complaint. DA presents the defendant with a copy of the Criminal Complaint. Complaint acknowledged,  reading waived.  Notice of right to attorney given to DE. Preliminary hearing requested, time limits NOT waived. Bond already set and is to continue. Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
Demand for Discovery and Notice of Intent to Use DNA

Contact through means of telephone. Electronic devices, Social media, email, regular mail, or a 3rd party individual is prohibited. The only exception to this order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate circumstances.

2:21 PM DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges. Defendant appeared via video from the Price County Jail. Karl J. Kelz appeared for The State of Wisconsin. DE next court date is 04/19/2022  at 10 am.  Jail gives DE a notice of right to attorney.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation. Bond ordered as requested.
